title: How to Restart Windows 10

steps.headline: Launch the Start menu.
steps.description:
Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png\/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

steps.headline: Click the power  icon.
steps.description:
A context menu that provides multiple different power options will appear. The icon is right above the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png\/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

steps.headline: Click Restart.
steps.description: Your device will turn off and power back on.

steps.headline: Launch the Power User menu.
steps.description:
Press the ⊞ Win+X keys together. Alternatively, right-click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png\/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} button. Touchscreen device users can hold down and release.

steps.headline: Hover over/select Shut down or sign out.
steps.description: This option is located second from the bottom. Choosing this will prompt a submenu to appear to the right of the main context menu. You can also press the U keyboard key.

steps.headline: Click Restart.
steps.description: Pressing the R keyboard key will perform the same action as clicking Restart.

methods.name: Using the "Shut Down Windows" Dialog Box

steps.headline: Navigate to the desktop.
steps.description:
Press ⊞ Win+D simultaneously. There are other different ways of doing this:

Close all open apps. Use the ✕ button. Clicking the very bottom-right of the screen, on the taskbar.

steps.headline: Open the "Shut Down Windows" dialog box.
steps.description: Press Alt+F4 together. Pressing the keys together while an app is displayed will cause the window to close.

steps.headline: Click the dropdown menu.
steps.description: It's right below the "What do you want the computer do do?" line of text.

steps.headline: Access the Windows Security Screen.
steps.description: Press the Ctrl+Alt+Del keys together. A blue screen containing many different links and icons should appear.

steps.headline: Click the power  icon.
steps.description: A context menu that provides multiple different power options will appear. The icon is at the bottom-right. It appears as circle with a vertical line towards the top of it.

steps.headline: Click Restart.
steps.description: Your device will turn off and power back on.

steps.headline: Open the Command Prompt.
steps.description: Press ⊞ Win+X and choose Command Prompt. You can also use the C key. You can also press ⊞ Win+R, type cmd, and hit ↵ Enter or click OK.

steps.headline: Enter shutdown/r.
steps.description: If wanted, you can substitute the slash / with a hyphen -. Abort the shutdown by using shutdown /a

steps.headline: Dismiss the notification.
steps.description: You'll get a notification telling you that you'll be signed out in less than a minute. Click Close to dismiss it.

Using the Start Menu Launch the Start menu. Click the Start {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/07/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/07/Windowsstart.png/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

"} button located at the bottom-left of the screen. Alternatively, press the ⊞ Win keyboard key. Click the power icon. A context menu that provides multiple different power options will appear. The icon is right above the Start {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/07/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/07/Windowsstart.png/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

"} button. It appears as circle with a vertical line towards the top of it. Click Restart. Your device will turn off and power back on. Using the Power User Menu Launch the Power User menu. Press the ⊞ Win+X keys together. Alternatively, right-click the Start {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/0/07/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/0/07/Windowsstart.png/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of a Windows icon.

License: Public Domain

"} button. Touchscreen device users can hold down and release. Hover over/select Shut down or sign out. This option is located second from the bottom. Choosing this will prompt a submenu to appear to the right of the main context menu. You can also press the U keyboard key. Click Restart. Pressing the R keyboard key will perform the same action as clicking Restart. Using the "Shut Down Windows" Dialog Box Navigate to the desktop. Press ⊞ Win+D simultaneously. There are other different ways of doing this: Close all open apps. Use the ✕ button. Clicking the very bottom-right of the screen, on the taskbar. Open the "Shut Down Windows" dialog box. Press Alt+F4 together. Pressing the keys together while an app is displayed will cause the window to close. Click the dropdown menu. It's right below the "What do you want the computer do do?" line of text. Choose the Restart option. Confirm the restart. Press OK or hit ↵ Enter. Using Ctrl + Alt + Del Access the Windows Security Screen. Press the Ctrl+Alt+Del keys together. A blue screen containing many different links and icons should appear. Click the power icon. A context menu that provides multiple different power options will appear. The icon is at the bottom-right. It appears as circle with a vertical line towards the top of it. Click Restart. Your device will turn off and power back on. Using the Command Prompt Open the Command Prompt. Press ⊞ Win+X and choose Command Prompt. You can also use the C key. You can also press ⊞ Win+R, type cmd, and hit ↵ Enter or click OK. Enter shutdown/r. If wanted, you can substitute the slash / with a hyphen -. Abort the shutdown by using shutdown /a Hit the ↵ Enter key. This will submit the command. Dismiss the notification. You'll get a notification telling you that you'll be signed out in less than a minute. Click Close to dismiss it.

Using the Power User Menu Launch the Power User menu.

Alternatively, right-click the Start {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png\/30px-Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":"30","bigHeight":"30","licensing":"

I edited this screenshot of a Windows icon.\n<\/p>

License: Public Domain<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} button.
Touchscreen device users can hold down and release.
Hover over/select Shut down or sign out.
This option is located second from the bottom.
Choosing this will prompt a submenu to appear to the right of the main context menu.
You can also press the U keyboard key.
Click Restart.
Pressing the R keyboard key will perform the same action as clicking Restart.
Using the "Shut Down Windows" Dialog Box Navigate to the desktop.
Press ⊞ Win+D simultaneously.

There are other different ways of doing this:

Close all open apps.
Use the ✕ button.
Clicking the very bottom-right of the screen, on the taskbar.
Open the "Shut Down Windows" dialog box.
Press Alt+F4 together.
Pressing the keys together while an app is displayed will cause the window to close.
Click the dropdown menu.
It's right below the "What do you want the computer do do?"
line of text.
Choose the Restart option.
Confirm the restart.
Press OK or hit ↵ Enter.
Using Ctrl + Alt + Del Access the Windows Security Screen.
Press the Ctrl+Alt+Del keys together.
A blue screen containing many different links and icons should appear.
Click the power  icon.
A context menu that provides multiple different power options will appear.
The icon is at the bottom-right.
It appears as circle with a vertical line towards the top of it.
Click Restart.
Your device will turn off and power back on.
Using the Command Prompt Open the Command Prompt.
Press ⊞ Win+X and choose Command Prompt.
You can also use the C key.
You can also press ⊞ Win+R, type cmd, and hit ↵ Enter or click OK.
Enter shutdown/r.
If wanted, you can substitute the slash / with a hyphen -.
Abort the shutdown by using shutdown /a Hit the ↵ Enter key.
This will submit the command.
Dismiss the notification.
You'll get a notification telling you that you'll be signed out in less than a minute.
Click Close to dismiss it.
